thread.title: Outdated Queensland abortion laws creating a 'tourism' of women travelling south
thread.title_full: Outdated Queensland abortion laws creating a 'tourism' of women travelling south

title: Outdated Queensland abortion laws creating a 'tourism' of women travelling south
text:
Outdated Queensland abortion laws cre... Outdated Queensland abortion laws creating a 'tourism' of women travelling south 13 hrs ago Read more: Sydney Morning Herald 
Abortion laws in Queensland are lagging behind modern medical practice, seeing many women travel interstate in what is being termed abortion 'tourism', two Queensland experts have revealed in the Medical Journal of Australia. The editorial, entitled Abortion law in Australia: it's time for national consistency and decriminalisation, notes diagnosis of foetal abnormality is now routinely offered to pregnant women at 10 to 13 weeks, with the implication that a woman, upon discovering a serious abnormality, may choose to terminate the pregnancy.   Sydney Morning Herald.
